meanings.definition: Lack of kindness or compassion towards others.
meanings.sent1: Her uncharitableness towards the homeless man was evident as she walked past without a second glance.
meanings.sent2: The uncharitableness of his actions left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent3: Despite her uncharitableness, she couldn't resist helping the injured puppy she found on the street.
meanings.sent4: The uncharitableness of the storm clouds mirrored the dark mood of the protagonist in the novel.
meanings.sent5: The uncharitableness of the dictator's regime was felt by all who dared to speak out against him.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unkind or lacking in generosity.
meanings.sent1: His uncharitableness towards his colleagues made it difficult for them to trust him.
meanings.sent2: The uncharitableness of her words stung more than any physical blow.
meanings.sent3: Despite his uncharitableness, he couldn't resist donating to the charity fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: The uncharitableness of the winter wind chilled them to the bone.
meanings.sent5: The uncharitableness of the landlord's actions towards the tenants caused an uproar in the community.
